intro: Sisyrinchium trichanthum, commonly known as the three-awned blue-eyed grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. Its flowers consist of three petals and three sepals, with a distinctive central stamen. Sisyrinchium trichanthum is adapted to arid environments and is often found in regions with well-drained soils.
